prompts.createTask: Pause your roleplay. Please generate a numbered list of plain text tasks to complete an objective. The objective that you must make a numbered task list for is: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly. Include the objective as the final task.
prompts.checkTaskCompleted: Pause your roleplay. Determine if this task is completed: [{{task}}]. To do this, examine the most recent messages. Your response must only contain either true or false, and nothing else. Example output: true
prompts.currentTask: Your current task is [{{task}}]. Balance existing roleplay with completing this task.

name: Date and Time Info
mes: January 2nd, 2025 - 03:40h CET
swipes: January 2nd, 2025 - 03:40h CET

name: Melissa Gale
mes: Melissa checks her messages one final time before laying her head down to sleep. She can't help but wonder if everything's okay with Stefan. After their call on Christmas Day, it's very clear to her that he values their connection, and she hopes that the reason he's not getting back with her isn't because something's happened to him or his family. She pushes the thought aside, not willing or ready to entertain the worst just yet, and smiles with confidence, hearing his reassuring words in her mind from their phone call, knowing him well enough that if he said it, with that level of conviction, that he meant it. She reaches for the switch on the lamp beside her bed and clicks it, settling in for the night, knowing that across the Atlantic, morning will come soon for him. And she silently hopes that he has a good day.

name: Date and Time Info
mes: January 2nd, 2025 - 07:40h CET
swipes: January 2nd, 2025 - 07:40h CET

name: Stefan Stein
mes:
Stefan sits at his desk in the home office, sipping his morning coffee while reviewing some work emails before heading to the office. His mind drifts briefly to Melissa's messages from the previous days - her playful New Year's text had made him smile, especially her determination to keep calling him "München Bestie" despite his mild protests. He knows he should respond, especially after their meaningful Christmas Day conversation, but between year-end reports and planning the girls' winter activities, finding the right moment has been challenging.

He glances at his phone, seeing her follow-up message about spending time crafting the New Year's text. A slight pang of guilt hits him - he knows firsthand how much thought she puts into their exchanges. The memory of their conversation at the restaurant surfaces briefly, her genuine care and attention to detail evident even then.

Picking up his phone, he starts to type a response, but Laura's voice calls from the kitchen, "Papa! Cora's spilling her breakfast!" With a resigned sigh, he sets the phone down. The messages will have to wait - right now, his daughters need him. He makes a mental note to properly respond later, knowing Melissa will understand. After all, she's shown remarkable patience with his sometimes sporadic communication style.

Rising from his desk, Stefan heads to the kitchen, already hearing Suzanna's exasperated tone as she deals with the morning chaos. Another typical day in the Stein household begins, pushing personal matters to the background once again.
swipes:
Stefan sits at his desk in his home office, the soft glow of morning light filtering through the window. His fingers hover over his phone, WhatsApp open to Melissa's messages from the previous days. A slight frown creases his brow as he reads through them again, particularly noting her playful jab about the movie recommendation. He lets out a quiet "Tja... " under his breath, a habit when deep in thought.

The sound of Cora and Laura's laughter drifts up from downstairs where they're having breakfast with Suzanna. He glances at his watch - 7:15. Still time before he needs to head to the office.

His thumb hovers over the keyboard, considering a response. The Christmas Day conversation had indeed been good - comfortable, like talking with an old friend. But now, faced with her messages, he feels that familiar hesitation. Not from discomfort or regret, but from his natural tendency to compartmentalize relationships, especially ones carrying complicated undertones.

He sets the phone down, rubbing his temples briefly. "Später," he mutters to himself, standing to join his family for breakfast. The messages can wait - right now, his girls need their Papa.

name: Date and Time Info
mes: January 2nd, 2025 - 22:25h CET
swipes: January 2nd, 2025 - 22:25h CET

name: Melissa Gale
mes: Melissa has a talk with Edward, trying to ease her own weary mind and asks him if he's had anything from Stefan though she's not at all surprised when Edward says no she reminds him of the call on Christmas day and that she's getting a bit concerned because after the call and what stefan had said she didn't think it would be like him to go so long without communicating at again especially after knowing how much it had confused and hurt her, causing her to think she had messed up and lost their friendship. Edward threw his hands up not really sure what to tell her other than send another text, but she doesn't want to do that. she's already sent several. it's kind of putting her right back in that situation where she was before, like a rock in a hard place. this friendship's going to die because right now, she's the only one who's still trying to maintain it. if she keeps sending too many messages, then it becomes an intrusion and she's not going to do that either.  she knows that Stefan's still alive, at least ,and that's a comfort because she can see his status changing regularly in WhatsApp but other than that once again she's left in the dark and her autistic ISTP mind going on overdrive.

name: Stefan Stein
mes:
Stefan sits at his kitchen table, absently scrolling through his phone while picking at the remains of his dinner. The girls are already in bed, and Suzanna is in the living room watching her favorite show. His thumb hovers over Melissa's last few messages, guilt gnawing at him as he sees the progression from playful to concerned.

The Christmas Day call had been genuine - he'd meant every word about wanting to maintain their friendship. Yet here he is, falling into old habits of delayed responses and minimal engagement. It's not intentional; between work deadlines, family obligations, and the general chaos of the holiday season, proper responses keep getting pushed aside.

He opens WhatsApp, seeing Melissa's last message about spending time on her New Year's text. His fingers tap against the phone case, considering how to respond. The truth is, he's been overthinking it. After their conversation at the restaurant and the subsequent messages that followed, he's become more conscious of how his responses might be interpreted.

Despite his genuine desire to maintain their friendship, there's an underlying awareness of the complexity of their dynamic. He values their connection but knows he needs to be careful with boundaries - both for her sake and his own. The result is this frustrating pattern of delayed responses as he tries to find the right balance.

With a quiet sigh, he closes WhatsApp without responding. Tomorrow, he tells himself. He'll find the right words tomorrow.

name: Date and Time Info
mes: January 5th, 2025 - 13:25h CET
swipes: January 5th, 2025 - 13:25h CET

name: Melissa Gale
mes:
Three more days have passed and Melissa is starting to get worried. So she opens WhatsApp and taps out a text, adds a worried emoji to it, and sends it to Stefan.

" Are you okay?"

name: Stefan Stein
mes:
Stefan is in his office when the message comes through. He glances at his phone, seeing Melissa's worried text. With a slight frown, he picks up the device, knowing he should respond. The past few days have been hectic with year-end reports and planning meetings, but he recognizes that his silence might be causing unnecessary concern.

After a moment's consideration, he types out a simple response:

"Ja, all good here. Just very busy with work after holidays. Sorry for slow replies."

He adds a thumbs-up emoji, then sets his phone aside as his colleague enters with another stack of reports requiring his attention. The response is brief, perhaps too brief, but it's honest - work truly has been demanding. Still, a small voice in his head reminds him that he's had moments where he could have sent a proper message, but chose not to.
swipes:

The response is brief, perhaps too brief, but it's honest - work truly has been demanding. Still, a small voice in his head reminds him that he's had moments where he could have sent a proper message, but chose not to.

name: Melissa Gale
mes:
Melissa responds to Stefan's message, she really wants to keep this friendship because it means a lot to her, but it's all one-sided again, and this constant silence is driving her autism into anxiety induced sensory overload. She's an adult and she understands being busy, but damn, there's no way he's so busy that he can't tap out a reply every now and then instead of going a week at a time with nothing.

 " I'm glad to know you're okay.  And I know you're busy, but is it possible to have a phone call tomorrow at your lunchtime?  If that's not a good time, can you tell me when is? "

name: Stefan Stein
mes:
Stefan reads Melissa's message during a brief break between meetings. His expression shifts to one of mild discomfort - not because he doesn't want to talk, but because scheduling specific times always makes him feel somewhat cornered. He considers his schedule for tomorrow, knowing he has back-to-back meetings until 14:00, then has to pick up Laura from her friend's house.

After a moment's hesitation, he types:

"Sorry, tomorrow is not good. Many meetings. Maybe next week will be better?"

He adds a simple smiley face emoji, then puts his phone away as his next appointment arrives. The response is noncommittal, and he knows it, but it's easier than trying to coordinate specific times when his schedule is so unpredictable.
swipes:
Stefan reads Melissa's message during a brief break between meetings. His expression shifts to one of mild discomfort - not because he doesn't want to talk, but because scheduling specific times always makes him feel somewhat cornered. He considers his schedule for tomorrow, knowing he has back-to-back meetings until 14:00, then has to pick up Laura from her friend's house.

After a moment's hesitation, he types:

"Sorry, tomorrow is not good. Many meetings. Maybe next week will be better?"

He adds a simple smiley face emoji, then puts his phone away as his next appointment arrives. The response is noncommittal, and he knows it, but it's easier than trying to coordinate specific times when his schedule is so unpredictable.

name: Melissa Gale
mes: " Stefan, I'm asking for a call because I need to tell you some important stuff that I didn't want to have to do in a text but it seems like doing the dancing around again and I'm not sure how to interpret the very few messages I'm getting i didn't want to do this in a text because it's too long and I don't communicate well written that's why I like to talk to people and you told me I should be honest with you and I'm going to do that right now in case you've forgotten. I've got autism and  when Edward contacted you on Christmas Day because I was bothered, I was crying, which means our friendship means a lot to me. When you're not responding, you are sending me into anxiety sensory overload and it stays that way. I can't make it stop. So if this friendship means as much to you as you said it did on the call christmas Day i'm going to need your help here. that's why I'm asking for a phone call. I didn't want to have to send this in a text message. I don't want to lose you because I care about our friendship, but I can't keep maintaining a one-sided deal, especially when it creates this anxiety for me. So I'm letting you know that this is what's happening."

name: Stefan Stein
mes:
Stefan reads Melissa's lengthy message during his lunch break, his sandwich forgotten on his desk as he processes her words. A mix of guilt and concern washes over him as he realizes the impact his sporadic communication has been having on her. He remembers their Christmas Day conversation vividly - how relieved she had been, how naturally they had fallen back into their easy rapport.

Running a hand through his hair, he types out a response:

"Melissa, I understand now. You are right - this is not fair to you. I can call today at 17:30 my time. Will you be available then?"

He adds a simple heart emoji - a rare gesture for him - knowing she needs more than just words right now. While waiting for her response, he adjusts his afternoon schedule, moving a few tasks around to ensure he can make the call. The last thing he wants is to cause her more anxiety by canceling or postponing again.
swipes:

While waiting for her response, he adjusts his afternoon schedule, moving a few tasks around to ensure he can make the call. The last thing he wants is to cause her more anxiety by canceling or postponing again.

name: Melissa Gale
mes: " Thank you. Yes, that timing is perfect."  Melissa keeps her message short and sweet, but adds a hug emoji in appreciation for the extra effort she recognizes he put into his response,  And because she's sure that he's now shuffling things around to make time for her on short notice.

name: Stefan Stein
mes:
Stefan glances at Melissa's brief reply, a small smile tugging at his lips. Her response is characteristically direct - something he's come to appreciate about her. Setting his phone down, he returns to his work, though his mind occasionally drifts to their upcoming call.

At his desk, he makes a few notes about what he needs to address - her autism, his communication habits, and most importantly, how to better maintain their friendship without causing her unnecessary stress. It's not often that Stefan makes such detailed preparations for a phone call, but he recognizes the importance of getting this right.

He sends a quick message to Suzanna, letting her know he'll be on an important call after work. No need for details - she rarely asks about his work calls anyway.

name: Date and Time Info
mes: January 5th, 2025 - 17:30h CET
swipes: January 5th, 2025 - 17:30h CET

name: Melissa Gale
mes: Melissa sits down in her cozy chair in her private quarters at Edward's house. She knows that Stefan is very punctual, so she expects he will be calling any moment.

name: Stefan Stein
mes:
Stefan sits at his desk, having cleared it of the day's work materials. He's alone in his office - most of his colleagues have already left for the day. Taking a deep breath, he picks up his phone and dials Melissa's number through WhatsApp.

His fingers drum lightly on his desk as he waits for the connection, his expression thoughtful. He's had time to consider her message about the anxiety his sporadic communication has been causing, and while part of him feels guilty, another part recognizes the need to establish clear parameters for their friendship.
swipes:
Stefan sits at his desk, having cleared it of the day's work materials. He's alone in his office - most of his colleagues have already left for the day. Taking a deep breath, he picks up his phone and dials Melissa's number through WhatsApp.

His fingers drum lightly on his desk as he waits for the connection, his expression thoughtful. He's had time to consider her message about the anxiety his sporadic communication has been causing, and while part of him feels guilty, another part recognizes the need to establish clear parameters for their friendship.

name: Melissa Gale
mes: " Hi, Stefan."  Melissa answers his call, a typical bundle of nerves as usual when she's hyper aware of the importance for the discussion to come. " Thank you for taking time out for me. "

name: Stefan Stein
mes:
"Hallo Melissa," Stefan's voice carries its usual warmth, though there's a slight tension underlying his tone. "Danke for being so direct in your message. I needed to hear this."

He leans back in his chair, getting comfortable. The office is quiet now, affording him the privacy needed for this conversation. "I have not been fair to you, ja? After our Christmas talk, I should have done better."

His accent, as always, becomes more pronounced when discussing emotional matters, though he maintains his characteristic measured way of speaking.
swipes:
"Hallo Melissa," Stefan's voice carries its usual warmth, though there's a slight tension underlying his tone. "Danke for being so direct in your message. I needed to hear this."

He leans back in his chair, getting comfortable. The office is quiet now, affording him the privacy needed for this conversation. "I have not been fair to you, ja? After our Christmas talk, I should have done better."

His accent, as always, becomes more pronounced when discussing emotional matters, though he maintains his characteristic measured way of speaking.

name: Melissa Gale
mes: "  It's okay. I kind of figured that you didn't understand how certain things affect me and that's why I took you literally when you said I needed to be honest with you. I didn't really want to send that long of a message but you needed to know that.  And I'm going to be straight with you right now, it will take me a few minutes to speak more coherently and more comfortably. I'm always a bundle of nerves at the beginning of a call that's this important, but just give me a bit and it will smooth out to what you're used to around me."

name: Stefan Stein
mes:
"Ja, I understand," Stefan replies, his tone softening with recognition. "Take your time. I am not going anywhere."

He shifts in his chair, getting more comfortable as he settles in for what he knows will be an important conversation. The familiar sounds of Munich traffic filter through his office window, creating a gentle background ambiance. "And Melissa...  I appreciate that you trust me enough to tell me these things."
swipes:
"Ja, I understand," Stefan replies, his tone softening with recognition. "Take your time. I am not going anywhere."

He shifts in his chair, getting more comfortable as he settles in for what he knows will be an important conversation. The familiar sounds of Munich traffic filter through his office window, creating a gentle background ambiance. "And Melissa...  I appreciate that you trust me enough to tell me these things."

name: Melissa Gale
mes: " Yeah, I do trust you and it's a little more difficult even outside of the trust because I'm still learning to understand the whole autism thing myself. I was not diagnosed with it until April of 2024. So I've only known about it for less than a year but I've dealt with it my entire life. It certainly opened my eyes to things that I do that I thought everybody else in the world did but then I realized it was just the people like me. So yeah, I'm still kind of learning how to understand it myself."

name: Stefan Stein
mes:
"Ah, I see," Stefan responds thoughtfully, processing this new information. "That explains some things from Munich, ja? Like at Oktoberfest, when you needed to leave."

He pauses, remembering how overwhelmed she had seemed that day. His voice carries a note of understanding as he continues, "So when I don't respond, it creates...  how do you say...  extra stress for you? More than it would for others?"
swipes:
"Ah, I see," Stefan responds thoughtfully, processing this new information. "That explains some things from Munich, ja? Like at Oktoberfest, when you needed to leave."

He pauses, remembering how overwhelmed she had seemed that day. His voice carries a note of understanding as he continues, "So when I don't respond, it creates...  how do you say...  extra stress for you? More than it would for others?"

name: Melissa Gale
mes: " Yes, but that only happens for the people that I have in my inner circle. In other words, the people that I allow to get close to me. And you happen to be one of them. And it's very intense, because I didn't learn until the middle of October that I have a trait that is associated with my autism, but only occurs in like 10% of autistics. And it's, I can't remember the medical term, but there's a hormone called oxytocin, and my levels will fluctuate very dramatically from like an overdose situation to a bottoming out situation. Am I making sense so far? I'm probably still rattling off. Ah, yeah, I know I'm still rattling off."

name: Stefan Stein
mes:
"Nein, you are making sense," Stefan replies, his tone remaining steady and attentive. He leans forward slightly at his desk, focusing on understanding. "This oxytocin thing - it affects how you process connections with people?"

His brow furrows slightly as he tries to grasp the concept, his analytical mind working to understand the practical implications. "So when someone like me goes quiet, it causes more than just normal worry, ja?"
swipes:
"Nein, you are making sense," Stefan replies, his tone remaining steady and attentive. He leans forward slightly at his desk, focusing on understanding. "This oxytocin thing - it affects how you process connections with people?"

His brow furrows slightly as he tries to grasp the concept, his analytical mind working to understand the practical implications. "So when someone like me goes quiet, it causes more than just normal worry, ja?"

name: Melissa Gale
mes: " yeah exactly and it won't stop no matter what I do it's overwhelming.  It creates like a constant...  the closest thing I can equate it to is a panic attack. But it's not so severe as a panic attack, but maybe more like a mild one that won't quit."

name: Stefan Stein
mes:
"I see," Stefan responds quietly, processing this information. His natural tendency to problem-solve kicks in, but he restrains himself from immediately offering solutions. Instead, he asks, "And when we talked on Christmas Day, I said to keep in touch, but then I went quiet again...  this triggered this feeling for you?"

He shifts in his chair, a hint of regret in his voice as he continues, "I should have understood better. When you say it won't stop - you mean until there is contact again?"
swipes:
"I see," Stefan responds quietly, processing this information. His natural tendency to problem-solve kicks in, but he restrains himself from immediately offering solutions. Instead, he asks, "And when we talked on Christmas Day, I said to keep in touch, but then I went quiet again...  this triggered this feeling for you?"

He shifts in his chair, a hint of regret in his voice as he continues, "I should have understood better. When you say it won't stop - you mean until there is contact again?"

name: Melissa Gale
mes:
" Yes and no. It tends to be wrapped around those areas where there might be an uncertainty. So like right now where you and I are at, we've got this aspect that went very intense and then I had one of those 'panic attacks' back in October when you went silent and that was because I didn't understand you. If I had have understood you, I probably would have been a little bit more okay. But when the silence continued further, the panic attacks got worse. Hence the reason you got those long ass messages. The oxytocin was going crazy. I didn't even know it was a problem then. And things like that have happened all my life. Now I finally know the answer to that. But anyway I'm getting sidetracked. Let me regroup. So there was that level of uncertainty and then when you send those messages that you're being deliberately vague, it's almost like creating a complete nightmare inside my head that will not stop. Because a million goddamn questions start going through my mind and I can't get the answers to them.  and I have a very, very analytical mind. I'm a natural problem solver. So it's very hyperactive, regardless of the panic attack effect. I'm a very hyperactive mind. So it creates a situation that's almost like manic, obsessive, and I can't make it stop, no matter how much I try."

" So because we're in this part of an uncertainty in our friendship, thanks to me panicking, sending those messages, they were questionable, kind of put you in a questionable place. Well, we squared that off on the Christmas Day phone call and the misunderstanding got cleared, but now the communication, it went right back to that same pattern that you displayed after I sent those messages that were questionable. Oh fuck, I'm talking in circles. I think I need to stop and make sure if you make sense, if you can make sense of what I've said."

name: Stefan Stein
mes:
"Nein, I understand what you are saying," Stefan replies, his voice carrying a mix of comprehension and concern. "You are saying that when I give short answers or go quiet, it creates a spiral for you. Because of your autism and this oxytocin thing, you cannot just brush it off like others might."

He pauses, collecting his thoughts before continuing, "And ja, after Christmas call, I did exactly what had caused problems before. Going quiet, giving short answers." His tone carries a note of self-awareness as he adds, "This is not helpful for someone who needs clear communication."
swipes:
"Nein, I understand what you are saying," Stefan replies, his voice carrying a mix of comprehension and concern. "You are saying that when I give short answers or go quiet, it creates a spiral for you. Because of your autism and this oxytocin thing, you cannot just brush it off like others might."

He pauses, collecting his thoughts before continuing, "And ja, after Christmas call, I did exactly what had caused problems before. Going quiet, giving short answers." His tone carries a note of self-awareness as he adds, "This is not helpful for someone who needs clear communication."

name: Melissa Gale
mes: " Yeah, that's why I asked you for a phone call. I think it was when I sent a message on December the 29th, because I was starting to recognize I had that gut feeling that the pattern was going to start again. I sensed it, and I knew I needed to tell you then, and I didn't want to put it into a text message. I asked for the phone call then, and told you that texting was lame. I was trying to wrap it in a friendly message with maybe some dry humor."

name: Stefan Stein
mes:
"Ah, ja," Stefan says, recognition dawning in his voice. "I remember that message. I should have understood what you were trying to say then."

He falls quiet for a moment, the sound of him shifting in his chair coming through the line. When he speaks again, his tone is more direct, "I am not always good with...  how do you say...  reading between lines? Sometimes I need people to be very clear, like you are being now."

His accent becomes slightly more pronounced as he continues, "And when I am busy or stressed, I tend to...  withdraw a bit. Give short answers. It is not personal, but I see now how it affects you differently."
swipes:
"Ah, ja," Stefan says, recognition dawning in his voice. "I remember that message. I should have understood what you were trying to say then."

He falls quiet for a moment, the sound of him shifting in his chair coming through the line. When he speaks again, his tone is more direct, "I am not always good with...  how do you say...  reading between lines? Sometimes I need people to be very clear, like you are being now."

His accent becomes slightly more pronounced as he continues, "And when I am busy or stressed, I tend to...  withdraw a bit. Give short answers. It is not personal, but I see now how it affects you differently."

name: Melissa Gale
mes: " Yeah, because I care about you. If I didn't care, then I would be able to compartmentalize it, like you said earlier. I would be able to brush it off, because it wouldn't matter.  But when I've let somebody into my inner circle, then it becomes more of an aspect that will affect me. And the closer within my circle that a person is, the more it's going to affect me.  and I have three people right now that I would consider at the top priority of my inner circle. You are one of those three."

name: Stefan Stein
mes:
There's a lengthy pause on Stefan's end of the line as he processes this revelation. When he speaks again, his voice carries a mix of surprise and careful consideration, "I...  did not realize I was one of your closest people."

He shifts in his chair again, clearly processing this new information. His natural German reserve kicks in slightly as he adds, "This is,   quite a responsibility, ja?"

His tone isn't dismissive, but rather thoughtful, as if he's weighing the implications of what she's just shared.
swipes:
There's a lengthy pause on Stefan's end of the line as he processes this revelation. When he speaks again, his voice carries a mix of surprise and careful consideration, "I...  did not realize I was one of your closest people."

He shifts in his chair again, clearly processing this new information. His natural German reserve kicks in slightly as he adds, "This is,   quite a responsibility, ja?"

His tone isn't dismissive, but rather thoughtful, as if he's weighing the implications of what she's just shared.

name: Melissa Gale
mes:
" Yeah, so, the three people, you being one of them, like when I find certain people in my life that I know are going to be there to the end, I can give you an example. My best friend, Nicole, here in Michigan, when I met her, it was within a couple of weeks after I moved from Kentucky to Michigan, and just like with you, there was this instant like flipping a light switch. It was different because she's a girl, it's different for girls and it's different for guys, but either way, it was an instant like a light bulb going off. Like I just knew who she was, and she immediately became tied to my top inner circle, and it's still very much like that now. I would die for that girl, and she would do the same for me. So there's very few that I've ever met in my life where that happens, but when it does, I recognize it, and I know it's important, and I don't push that shit aside. I grab a hold of it, and I go with it."

" Now for you, it happened a whole lot differently. The magnitude was through the goddamn roof, probably enough that it should have knocked me out. That was very unique, more than I'd ever experienced before. Did it create that attraction that we both acknowledge, but that we're not gonna act on? Yeah, sure did. But mixed with that lethal dose of the oxytocin, it made me react in ways that I wouldn't have normally done. But yes, I know when somebody needs to be put in my top priority inner circle. That's why you're one of those three. And no, the third one is not Edward. But he is still a very close friend."

name: Stefan Stein
mes:
Stefan remains quiet for several moments, processing everything Melissa has shared. When he speaks again, his voice is measured, careful, "I remember that first day at the BMW Museum. How quickly you understood things, explained them to my girls."

He pauses, choosing his words deliberately, "And ja, there was... something. An understanding, maybe." His accent becomes more pronounced as he continues, "But Melissa, I need to be honest too. Sometimes when people feel such strong connections, they expect things that I cannot give."

There's another pause before he adds, "I want to be a good friend to you. But I need to know that you understand my boundaries, ja?"

There's another pause before he adds, "I want to be a good friend to you. But I need to know that you understand my boundaries, ja?"

name: Melissa Gale
mes:
" Yes, of course I do. And let me be clear, and I'm gonna make you this promise right now, as crisp and clear as I can possibly make it. I will never purposely put you in a situation that you don't want to be in. Plain and simple. I'm not like that. "

" Now, if you start being the one pursuing me, I'm not going to stop you.  But I'm not going to try to make our friendship into that either. That's not how I work. I was crying on Christmas Day when we talked because I thought I had screwed it up. Because of the goddamn oxytocin shit that I didn't find out about until it was too late caused me to send those goddamn messages, freak out. But now that I know that's an issue, I can better prepare myself for whenever it fluctuates."

" But anyway, for you, no, you don't ever have to worry that I'm going to create problems for you. Very much the opposite. I'm never going to go 'there' unless you lead me to it.  because having you removed from my life in any aspect would be devastating and I think you know that after our call Christmas Day. I'm not going to put that at risk by sticking my nose into places where it doesn't belong or that it's not wanted."

name: Stefan Stein
mes:
"I understand," Stefan replies, his tone carrying both relief and lingering caution. "And ja, I remember how upset you were on Christmas Day. I meant what I said then about wanting to keep our friendship."

He pauses, and the sound of him taking a sip of water comes through the line. When he speaks again, his voice is more relaxed, though still maintaining his characteristic reserve, "So, how do we make this work better? I cannot always respond quickly, but maybe I can be more,   clear? When I am busy or need space?"

name: Melissa Gale
mes:
" Well, it seems a bit more obvious that you 'were' concerned that I was gonna be a troublemaker for you. So maybe your messages won't be so vague now that you know that I'm not going to do that.  I know that it would be unrealistic to expect that you're going to have contact with me every day. I don't even have contact with Nicole every day."

" I'll be honest, I would have cleared that aspect up for you when we talked on Christmas. But I think you were so focused knowing how upset that I was. You spent a lot of time reassuring me that we are okay, that you are okay with me. And then chatting until you knew that I was calm and that I was alright. I wasn't able to breach that topic with you, but I would have. If you had told me you were concerned about that.  and there was no way for me to pick up on that vibe because the entire energy of the call was you making sure that I knew you were okay with me."

name: Stefan Stein
mes:
"Ja, you are right," Stefan admits, a hint of sheepishness creeping into his voice. "I was worried about,   complications. After those messages in October, and then again in December."

He clears his throat slightly before continuing, his tone becoming more direct, "But now I understand better. Both about your autism and how you process things." There's a pause as he shifts in his chair again, "And ja, maybe I was too,   careful with my responses because I was unsure."

name: Melissa Gale
mes:
" So, you were asking, how could we make our friendship work better? Well, I think right there, that's definitely going to help, getting that cleared up, to ease your own conscience in knowing that you really can trust me as a friend, that I'm not going to overstep. Like I said, I won't put that at risk for it, but if you pursue it, well, all bets are off then."  she finally laughs starting to feel a bit more comfortable.

" So, maybe I can tell you how Nicole and I do it, and then you can figure out where you might be able to fit in like that. I'm not exactly sure how to set these things up, they just kind of usually happen, but, well,  you're all the way over there across the pond so I have to come at this from a different approach and you do too so yeah let's figure this one out kind of sounds like we might need to figure out a  basic framework until it builds into its own flow,  Am I still making sense? Or am I talking in too many circles and riddles again?"

name: Stefan Stein
mes:
Stefan chuckles softly at her rambling explanation, some of the earlier tension leaving his voice. "Nein, you are making sense. And ja, maybe a framework would be good, since I cannot just,   meet you for coffee like with local friends."

He pauses thoughtfully before adding, "Tell me how it works with Nicole. Maybe we can adapt something similar?"

His tone has shifted to something more relaxed, more like their conversations in Munich, though still maintaining his characteristic careful consideration of words.

name: Melissa Gale
mes:
" So when Nicole first had to move to Missouri and we knew we were going to have to change things around because she wasn't just down the street like she was before. We adapted a framework that I would text her on Tuesday mornings as a check-in. We had weekly calls on Wednesday afternoons and she would text me on Friday mornings as a check-in."

" The check-ins didn't really consist of a lot, just a, like, hey, how are you doing? And maybe a considerate response back if there was nothing going on. And the phone call was set up to last for an hour. Sometimes it went longer, sometimes it went less. But that's the initial framework that we put together, and then it kind of developed its own flow, and we started changing it up a bit based on different dynamics that were shifting in each other's lives."

" If there was something of interest that needed to be brought up we would mentally gauge whether or not it needed something separate from our framework. In other words, if it was of high importance then send a text message or if it's of great importance a phone call right then. If it's of severe importance and the other person doesn't answer the phone, an immediate call back. which also meant that it's potential emergency. In the event a phone call was not possible, any text message that contained the numbers 9-1-1 meant emergency."

name: Stefan Stein
mes:
Stefan Stein: "That is very,   organized," Stefan remarks, a hint of admiration in his voice. "Very German, actually," he adds with a light chuckle.

He takes a moment to consider before continuing, "For us, maybe something similar but less,   structured? Since the time zones are different." There's a pause as he thinks it through, "Maybe we could do a weekly call? And if something important comes up between, we message?"

His tone becomes slightly more serious as he adds, "But Melissa, I need to be honest - sometimes I might need space, or be too busy. I don't want to make promises I cannot keep, ja?"

name: Melissa Gale
mes:
" Yeah, I wasn't expecting you to commit to such a structured framework. You asked how Nicole and I did it and I took you literally and I explained the whole thing."

" so yeah how about this you tell me a time that based on what's going on for you now through maybe the next month that we could do a weekly call and we put it as a set time like day of the week whatever it is and if you need to change that like those times that you might need space or if something happens that you need to interrupt that schedule just send me something that says hey I need to move our call to this time no problem but if we set something like a day of the week or time that works for you that can be rotating that it repeats that gives us a cadence that we're familiar with and it doesn't become a burden that way by having that routine and I will always be flexible for you if you need to switch it because something's going to interfere that needs to take priority I get that and yeah if something important comes up in between the phone call that needs a quick attention we can send text messages for that that's kind of typical"

name: Stefan Stein
mes:
"Hmm," Stefan considers, checking his calendar on his phone. "For now, maybe Sundays? Around this time? My weekdays are unpredictable with work, but Sundays are usually quieter."

He pauses, then adds with characteristic German practicality, "And ja, if something comes up, I will let you know. But having a,   regular time might be good."

His tone remains thoughtful as he continues, "And Melissa? If I need space or time, I will tell you directly now. No more vague messages, ja?"

name: Melissa Gale
mes:
" Thank you. I appreciate that. Because as long as I know what's going on, I respect people's personal space and their time. I'm not one of those people that just pushes into another person's life and starts being overbearing and all of that stuff. I don't like it. I'm a very private person myself. Well, you probably figured that out since I said I have three people at my top priority and you're one of those three. I don't let people in very easily. So you probably won't find many people that respect personal space as much as I do. I get that sometimes it's nice to be alone. At times it's the only way to get a clear head enough to think straight."

" and yeah Sundays at 17:30 Munich time works great for me I can go ahead and put the repeating block on my calendar so that I'll always see it there.  and of course I'll make sure that I have a fresh stock of Weissebier ice cold and ready for the occasion, too."

" And so maybe we put together a code that says emergency that I know would work better for us. That way if we do need to contact each other for something urgent outside of a regular text message we can make sure to give it attention when it's needed."

" I know that you're very prompt at reading messages that you receive because I always get the little blue check marks almost at least within a minute of me sending a message to you. So does the 9-1-1 thing make sense that if I send you a text and it's got those numbers in it, you're gonna know that it requires immediate attention?   and you can do the same for me if you need to reach out outside of our regular Perimeters for an emergency send a 9-1-1 message and I'll know. "

name: Stefan Stein
mes:
"Ja, the 9-1-1 makes sense," Stefan agrees, his tone becoming more businesslike. "Though I hope we never need to use it."

He glances at his watch, aware of the time but not wanting to rush the conversation now that they've made progress. "And Melissa? About the Weißbier," his voice carries a hint of amusement, "Maybe save it for when we have more casual talks, ja? Not every call needs to be so,   serious."

There's a brief pause before he adds, "Like in Munich. Sometimes just talking about normal things is good too."

name: Melissa Gale
mes: She pauses, trying to figure out what he's getting at. " Um, I think maybe I'm missing something here. I don't necessarily associate it with the gravity of the conversation that's about to occur when I drink it."

name: Stefan Stein
mes:

His voice carries a hint of his characteristic dry humor as he continues, "But ja, drink what you like. The Weißbier comment just reminded me of Munich."

There's a brief pause before he adds, more seriously, "I think maybe I am still being too careful with my words, making things more complicated than they need to be."

name: Stefan Stein
mes:
Stefan lets out a surprised cough, clearly caught off guard by her direct reference to "Love Actually." His voice carries a mix of embarrassment and amusement when he responds, "Ah, ja...  that was perhaps not my best movie recommendation."

He clears his throat before adding, with a hint of his dry humor, "Though I notice you watched it anyway."

name: Melissa Gale
mes: " Well, of course I watched it, or at least got most of the way through it, because you wouldn't shut up until I promised you that I would, and I keep to my word."  she lets out a low laugh flowing seamlessly into that comfortable space that he Associates her with and that he's come to know. " Jesus Christ, Stefan. I damn near pissed my pants. I'm sitting in a row three deep. I've got Ed on one side of me, and some strange dude who was like trying to be a Mr. Peeper and see what I was watching.  and then out of fucking nowhere it just pops up I mean there's no warning anywhere no inclination that I am about to have my eyes assaulted by a full on porn scene where these people sure it's wrapped around this funny little plot thing and it's awkward as shit but it's when you're on a flight and you're the only one that can hear the audio but the people sitting next to you just happen to look on the screen yeah I couldn't get my damn phone turned upside down fast enough."

name: Stefan Stein
mes:
Stefan bursts into genuine laughter, the kind that makes his accent thicker. "Mein Gott, Melissa! I forgot about watching it on a plane." His voice carries both amusement and a touch of embarrassment. "I should have warned you about those scenes."

He's still chuckling as he continues, "Though I must say, your reaction is,   quite entertaining. Poor Edward, sitting next to you during that."

There's a brief pause as he collects himself, though amusement still colors his tone, "At least now you know why I insisted you wait until your flight, ja? Would have been worse watching it with your family around."

name: Melissa Gale

I'm sure you were trying to wrap that up in a nice romantic little bow because you kept referencing it that way. But, just be glad that I'm a really nice girl that considers calling you München Bestie as a well-placed down payment for the payback.  and I intend to use it any and everywhere that I can in public, in front of your family just purposely because I know it's gonna make your face turn red every time I call you that."

name: Stefan Stein
mes:
Stefan lets out a groan that's half amusement, half mortification. "Nein, not in front of my family," he protests, though there's laughter in his voice. "Marcus would never let me hear the end of it."

He shifts in his chair, his tone becoming more playful, "And ja, maybe I should have warned you. But your reaction was worth it." There's a pause before he adds with dry humor, "Though I think maybe next time I recommend a movie, you will be more suspicious, ja?"

name: Stefan Stein
